page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY 1
page.content: Rickmansworth has grown up from a settlement of 15 to 20 families and the Lord of the Manor in 1085 to over 29,000 people in 1985.It dates back to Roman times but the earliest written reference is when King Offa of Mercia founded an Abbey at St.Albans in 780 and gave the monks the land around Rickmansworth,Croxley Green and Batchworth. Thomas Wolsey,the Abbot of St.Albans from 1521,spent time at a mansion here,called Le More, which brought extra trade to the town.Buildings which have survived from this period include the Priory,the Feathers public house,the former blacksmith's forge in Bury Lane and the Church Tower (restored in 1630).Thomas Wolsey contributed to the growth of Rickmansworth by building a new road to Watford and in 1520 he helped to
